page.title: 05CONCLUSION
page.content: CONCLUSION The Doomsday Book of 1086 makes no mention of the Alston Moor district. However,it seems likely that the lead and silver mining recorded in Roman times would still be active and therefore supporting a community in the area. Research based on comparisons of the 1971 and 1981 census figures,indicates that the area is becoming a more attractive area in which to live: a fact demonstrated by the number of derelict properties now being renovated. The disadvatages of harsh climate and remoteness are becoming less significant with improvments in communications and technology. The area is becoming increasingly attractive to people looking for holiday and weekend homes.
